title: Dan Snyder Tries to End an Era of NFL Scandal With a Progressive Pivot
sub_head: A diverse front office. A gender-neutral dance team. His wife as the new co-CEO. Snyder, the owner of the Washington Football Team, speaks out on his bid to fix a franchise plagued by internal problems.
body:
Dan Snyder was terribly nervous.
A year and a half ago, the owner of the Washington Football Team stood on a dais and began one of his infrequent public statements with a viral gaffe that seemed to dovetail with a billionaire often viewed as aloof and out of touch. “First off, happy Thanksgiving everybody,” he said. Unfortunately, he was speaking in January.
“I didn’t read the part where it said, ‘We started this journey on Thanksgiving,’” he says now.
It was a small slip up on what is a perilous journey for Snyder: attempting to reform a culture and workplace environment that has produced losses on the field and far darker problems off of it.
Snyder, amid an ongoing investigation overseen by the NFL into allegations of misconduct inside the team, is attempting a difficult maneuver. He says he wants to establish a “gold standard” work culture at a team whose operations had been marred by inappropriate behavior, in-fighting and a team name viewed by many as racist.
